Diagnostic_Criteria: New-onset seizures (<15 days), solitary cysticercus granuloma on imaging
Age_Mean_SD: Group I: median 20 years (IQR 13-32), Group II: median 18 years (IQR 15-26)
Focal_Seizures_Percentage: Group I: 17.8% focal, 73.2% focal with generalization; Group II: 10.7% focal, 91.3% with generalization
Imaging_Schedule: CT at 3 months, MRI at 6 months
Complete_Resolution_Percentage: CT at 3m: 46.7% (prednisolone) vs 39.8% (placebo); MRI at 6m: 46.7% vs 38.9%
Other_AE: Skin rash in 3 prednisolone and 2 placebo patients (attributed to carbamazepine)
Comments: Prednisolone did not improve overall seizure control or lesion resolution but reduced generalized seizures (15.8% vs 60%, p=0.015). Study suggests limited benefit of steroids alone.
